information.title: SharePoint Factory
information.description: Create a collection of application pages implemented as user controls; package them for deployment as Microsoft SharePoint 2010 Feature with a single Web Part. Integrate a line-of-business database application with a widely adopted corporate web content management system.

message.text: backup the previous version of the project

if.test: c:fields/c:field[string-length(c:codeFormula)>0 or string-length(c:codeDefault)>0 or string-length(c:codeValue)>0 or string-length(c:items/@targetController)>0] or .//c:dataField[string-length(c:codeFilter)>0] or c:views/c:view[@virtualViewId!='']

action.name: Develop
action.toolTip: Open in Visual Studio to customize the project.
action.hint: You will be prompted to elevate permissions to allow debugging under Microsoft SharePoint.

action.name: Browse
action.toolTip: Compile and view the host app in a web browser.

action.name: Publish
action.toolTip: Publish the web application to local SharePoint website.

group.name: Namespace
group.description: Specify location of your local SharePoint website.

group.name: Namespace
group.description: Change the source code namespace and target .NET framework of the generated web application.

group.name: Connection
group.description: Configure database connection provider and connection string properties.

group.name: BLL
group.description: Configue shared business rules, data access objects, relationship discovery, denormalization map, and text label construction.

group.name: Reports
group.description: Enable or disable automatic reports in your application.

group.name: Features
group.description: Specify global features of the generated baseline application.

group.name: Layout
group.description: Specify the page data view layout preferences. Select simple, tabbed, classic, inline, or stacked layout.

group.name: Globalization
group.description: Enter globalization and localization settings of this application.

group.name: WebServer
group.description: Configure development web server and enter runtime configuration properties of the application.
